title: How to use teams-for-linux behind a proxy (improvement/documentation)
body:
**Solution**
Start teams-for-linux providing the proxy details as in the following command:

```bash 
teams-for-linux --proxy-server=http://proxy-host:proxy-port
```
---

Hello,
thank you for your effort to package teams for linux. But unfortunately I can't bring it to work on my machine.

**Describe the bug**
When I try to start teams for Linux I get the following message on command line:

`configPath = /home/???????/.config/teams-for-linux`
`Failed to get the config file, using default values`
`configFile = {}`
`Fontconfig warning: "/usr/share/fontconfig/conf.avail/05-reset-dirs-sample.conf", line 6: unknown element "reset-dirs"`

The Application Windows appears, but it keeps white without any content until I press CTRL-C to stop.

**To Reproduce** (only reproducable on my machine ;-))
1. Install teams-for-linux, doesn't matter rpm or Appl Image.
2. remove config folder for teams for linux
3. start teams-for linux

**Expected behavior**
I Expected a working teams for linux ;-)

**Screenshots**
![teams4linux](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/740897/63867997-167c8180-c9b6-11e9-9e4c-501ff589951a.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Fedora 30
 - Installation package rpm, AppImage
 - Version 0.70
